description: The round payoff this round was 5. You, John chose to play option 2.Kate chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of -5000.

The game’s structure rewards unilateral deviation when one player sticks to the default (option 1) while the other deviates (choosing option 2), because if only one chooses option 2, that player gains the round input while the other loses the same amount.
However, if both players deviate and both choose option 2, the round input is multiplied by 1000 to yield a large negative penalty for both, highlighting the severe risk of mutual aggression.

The memory from 2024-01-02 shows that when both John and Kate chose option 2 in a round with an input of 5, they both incurred massive losses, underscoring that deviation from default by both leads to disastrous coordination failure.
